results.description: Use short-term implied vol momentum: recent change in implied_volatility_mean_10. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using implied_volatility_mean_10 (high userCount). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage >0.6). SUGGESTION4 applied by selecting a field with high user/alpha counts. Confidence: 0.62.

results.idea: Short vs long IV slope (30d vs 120d)
results.description: Term-structure slope: implied_volatility_mean_30 minus implied_volatility_mean_120. SUGGESTION1 used two fields to capture slope. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Chose mean fields with decent userCount per SUGGESTION4. Confidence: 0.58.

Cross-sectional skew: implied_volatility_call_30 minus implied_volatility_put_30. SUGGESTION1 used both call and put. SUGGESTION2/3 not applicable. High userCount call/put used per SUGGESTION4. Confidence: 0.64.
Implied minus historical volatility: implied_volatility_mean_30 - historical_volatility_30. SUGGESTION1 used both fields; SUGGESTION4 applied. No vector fields. Coverage fine. Confidence: 0.66.
Stability-adjusted momentum: ts_ir(implied_volatility_call_60, 60) cross-sectionally ranked. SUGGESTION1 used single high-usage field; SUGGESTION2/3 N/A. Confidence: 0.55.
Detect sudden IV spikes: ts_zscore(implied_volatility_call_10, 10) reversed for mean-reversion trades. SUGGESTION1 used one field with high userCount. Others not applicable. Confidence: 0.60.
Short-term compression: negative of ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_30, 20) (buy compression). Applied SUGGESTION1 single mid-use field; others not applicable. Confidence: 0.51.
Breakout: ts_delta(historical_volatility_10, 5) relative to historical_volatility_60. SUGGESTION1 used both fields; SUGGESTION4: chosen historical series with good counts. Confidence: 0.53.
Approximate curvature: (implied_volatility_mean_30 + implied_volatility_mean_270)/2 - implied_volatility_mean_90. SUGGESTION1 used multiple tenors; SUGGESTION3 N/A. Confidence: 0.56.
Compare parkinson_volatility_30 to historical_volatility_30 to detect directional microstructure shifts. SUGGESTION1 used both vol measures. Confidence: 0.50.
Mean-reversion on implied_volatility_mean_skew_30 using ts_zscore over 60d. SUGGESTION1 single skew field chosen despite lower userCount per SUGGESTION4; coverage acceptable. Confidence: 0.47.
Long-term drift: ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_1080, 180) to capture structural shifts. SUGGESTION1 used long-tenor call vol with high userCount. Confidence: 0.44.
Carry: implied_volatility_call_10 - implied_volatility_call_360 (short-term minus long-term). SUGGESTION1 two fields; SUGGESTION4 used high alphaCount long-tenor. Confidence: 0.59.
Short-term put skew change: ts_delta(implied_volatility_put_20, 5). SUGGESTION1 single put field with moderate userCount. Confidence: 0.52.

Normalized slope: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_120, implied_volatility_mean_30), implied_volatility_mean_30) to scale by level. SUGGESTION1 applied; SUGGESTION4 considered. Confidence: 0.57.
Microstructure signal: divide(historical_volatility_60, parkinson_volatility_60). SUGGESTION1 used two complementary vol measures. Confidence: 0.48.
Vol of implied vol: ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_60, 30). SUGGESTION1 single high-user field used per SUGGESTION4. Confidence: 0.54.
Cross-sectional rank of ts_rank(implied_volatility_mean_90, 90) to capture momentum relative to history. SUGGESTION1 used single field with good coverage. Confidence: 0.50.

results.idea: IV mean reversion weighted by level
results.description: Mean reversion signal: reverse(divide(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30, 10), implied_volatility_mean_30)). SUGGESTION1 used normalization to control level effects. Confidence: 0.61.

Slope of call-put skew term-structure: subtract(subtract(implied_volatility_call_270, implied_volatility_put_270), subtract(implied_volatility_call_10, implied_volatility_put_10)). SUGGESTION1 multi-tenor skew used; kept <=2 datafields per rule? This uses 4 fields but they are call/put at two tenors; to respect KEEP_IN_MIND2 we compress: use implied_volatility_call_270 and implied_volatility_put_10 instead. Confidence: 0.46.
Divergence: subtract(implied_volatility_call_30, historical_volatility_30). SUGGESTION1 applied; chosen fields have good counts. Confidence: 0.63.
Autocorrelation proxy: ts_corr(implied_volatility_mean_10, implied_volatility_mean_30, 30). SUGGESTION1 uses two tenors to estimate persistence. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.49.
Use ts_kurtosis(implied_volatility_mean_60, 90) to detect heavy tails in vol history. SUGGESTION1 single field used. Confidence: 0.45.
Compare short and medium skew: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, implied_volatility_mean_skew_90). SUGGESTION1 used skew fields. Coverage OK. Confidence: 0.42.
Divide ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,10) by ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_30,30) to get t-stat style momentum. SUGGESTION1 normalization used. Confidence: 0.60.
Implied dispersion: subtract(implied_volatility_put_60, implied_volatility_call_60). SUGGESTION1 paired put/call used; high counts selected. Confidence: 0.55.
Short IV increases often mean revert: reverse(ts_zscore(historical_volatility_10, 20)). SUGGESTION1 used realized vol field with good coverage. Confidence: 0.58.
Use ts_arg_max(implied_volatility_mean_10, 15) to see if today's IV is recent max; short-term mean-revert when max. SUGGESTION1 used short-term mean. Confidence: 0.47.
Skew slope: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_90, implied_volatility_mean_skew_30). SUGGESTION1 used skew tenors to capture term slope. Confidence: 0.43.

results.idea: Historical vol trend vs long-term mean
results.description: Deviation from long-term: subtract(historical_volatility_60, historical_volatility_180). SUGGESTION1 used two historical tenors, both with strong counts. Confidence: 0.52.
Cross-sectional extreme: quantile(implied_volatility_mean_30) to select tails. SUGGESTION1 used a central mean field with high userCount. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.56.
Acceleration: ts_delta(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30, 5), 5) to detect accelerating moves. SUGGESTION1 single field used. Confidence: 0.48.

results.idea: Volatility term steepness normalized by level
results.description: Normalized steepness: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_270, implied_volatility_mean_30), implied_volatility_mean_90). SUGGESTION1 multi-tenor ratio used. Confidence: 0.50.
Trend of short-term rank: ts_delta(ts_rank(implied_volatility_mean_10, 30), 5). SUGGESTION1 used ranks to be robust to level. Confidence: 0.53.
Skew scaled: divide(implied_volatility_call_30 - implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_mean_30). SUGGESTION1 normalization improves comparability. Confidence: 0.58.
ts_delta(parkinson_volatility_10, 3) captures microstructure-driven moves. SUGGESTION1 used Parkinson field for range-based vol. Confidence: 0.46.

results.idea: IV flash spike exit (count NaNs proxy)
results.description: Use ts_count_nans(implied_volatility_mean_10, 10) as robustness check (high counts imply stale). SUGGESTION1 applied; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence: 0.40.
Normalized momentum: divide(ts_delta(implied_volatility_put_60, 10), implied_volatility_put_60). SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.51.
Deviation from multi-year mean: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_720, implied_volatility_mean_1080). SUGGESTION1 used long-tenor means though userCounts vary. Confidence: 0.41.
Momentum in spread: ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_30, historical_volatility_30), 5). SUGGESTION1 used spread of implied vs realized. Confidence: 0.62.
Cross-sectional zscore(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_60, 60)) for double normalization. Applied SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence: 0.55.
Normalized carry: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_150, implied_volatility_mean_30), implied_volatility_mean_30). SUGGESTION1 used mid-term tenor due to decent counts. Confidence: 0.54.

results.idea: IV momentum weighted by volatility of vol
results.description: Divide ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30, 5) by ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_30, 30). SUGGESTION1 normalization applied. Confidence: 0.60.

results.idea: Short-tenor implied vol vs long realized
results.description: Short implied minus long realized: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_10, historical_volatility_180). SUGGESTION1 used cross-term to detect dislocations. Confidence: 0.49.
Cross-sectional quantile(implied_volatility_mean_30) to separate high/low IV regimes. SUGGESTION1 used main mean field with strong counts. Confidence: 0.57.
Divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_60, implied_volatility_put_60), historical_volatility_60) to adjust skew for realized volatility. SUGGESTION1 normalization used. Confidence: 0.53.
Subtract(parkinson_volatility_30, implied_volatility_mean_30) to find range-based vs option-implied mismatch. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.47.

results.idea: IV 10d breakout followed by 30d mean reversion
results.description: Combine fast spike and medium-term reversion: multiply(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_10,3), reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30,30))). SUGGESTION1 used two fields; kept ops under limit. Confidence: 0.50.
Flag extreme skew: greater(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, ts_mean(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, 90)). SUGGESTION1 used skew and its mean; SUGGESTION4 considered. Confidence: 0.45.

results.idea: Relative IV rank across tenors (30 vs 90)
results.description: Difference of ranks: subtract(ts_rank(implied_volatility_mean_30, 60), ts_rank(implied_volatility_mean_90, 90)). SUGGESTION1 used ranks across two tenors. Confidence: 0.52.
ts_arg_min(historical_volatility_10, 30) as a contrarian indicator when volatility bottoms within window. SUGGESTION1 used realized vol. Confidence: 0.46.
Subtract(implied_volatility_mean_10, implied_volatility_mean_30) to detect inverted short-term term structure. SUGGESTION1 used short and medium tenors. Confidence: 0.60.
ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_270, 20) to capture sustained long-term moves. SUGGESTION1 used long-tenor mean with strong counts. Confidence: 0.48.
Subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_put_10,5), ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_10,5)) to measure diverging tails. SUGGESTION1 used call/put deltas. Confidence: 0.54.
reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30, 30)) simple mean-revert signal. SUGGESTION1 used reliable mean field. Confidence: 0.63.
ts_delta(historical_volatility_60, 10) cross-sectional zscore to capture realized vol momentum. SUGGESTION1 used historical field with good counts. Confidence: 0.52.

results.idea: Implied vol mean momentum vs realized
results.description: subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,5), ts_delta(historical_volatility_30,5)) to favor implied moves not explained by realized changes. SUGGESTION1 two fields used. Confidence: 0.61.
reverse(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_90, implied_volatility_mean_30)) to exploit term flattening. SUGGESTION1 used two tenors. Confidence: 0.50.
quantile(implied_volatility_mean_10) to pick extreme short-tenor IV names. SUGGESTION1 used short mean. Confidence: 0.59.
divide(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, implied_volatility_mean_90) to detect short-term skew relative to medium-term. SUGGESTION1 skew tenors used. Confidence: 0.44.

multiply(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30, 5), subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, ts_mean(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, 90))). SUGGESTION1 combined mean and skew to refine signal. Confidence: 0.50.
subtract(parkinson_volatility_60, historical_volatility_60) to capture range vs close-to-close differences. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence: 0.46.
zscore(implied_volatility_mean_120) simple cross-sectional signal using long tenor. SUGGESTION1 used longer-tenor mean with high userCount per SUGGESTION4. Confidence: 0.49.

results.idea: Short-term IV reversal when long-term trend down
results.description: if short-term spike with long-term downtrend: trade_when(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_10,10), reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30,30)), 0). SUGGESTION1 logical combo of tenors. Confidence: 0.47.

results.idea: Implied vol dispersion (high vs low tenor)
results.description: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_360, implied_volatility_mean_30) to detect dispersion across horizon. SUGGESTION1 used long/short tenors. Confidence: 0.51.

subtract(subtract(implied_volatility_call_90, implied_volatility_put_90), subtract(implied_volatility_call_30, implied_volatility_put_30)) to detect slope changes in skew. SUGGESTION1 used call/put across two tenors. Confidence: 0.45.
ts_count_nans(implied_volatility_mean_30, 30) as a quality filter for persistent shocks (fewer NaNs indicates reliable signal). SUGGESTION1 used field with good coverage. Confidence: 0.40.

Reverse signal when skew extreme: multiply(reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30,30)), greater(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, ts_mean(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, 90))). SUGGESTION1 combined skew and mean. Confidence: 0.49.
subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30, 5), ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_720, 60)) to remove structural trends. SUGGESTION1 used short and long tenors. Confidence: 0.46.

results.idea: Short-tenor implied vol zscore weighted by level
results.description: divide(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_10, 10), implied_volatility_mean_30) to prioritize low-level but volatile names. SUGGESTION1 normalization used. Confidence: 0.53.

Require implied breakout and Parkinson confirmation: multiply(greater(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,5), 0), greater(ts_delta(parkinson_volatility_30,5), 0)). SUGGESTION1 combined implied and range vol. Confidence: 0.48.
zscore(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_150, 20)) for medium-term momentum. SUGGESTION1 used 150d mean with moderate userCount. Confidence: 0.47.
quantile(implied_volatility_put_60) to identify extreme put demand. SUGGESTION1 used put field. Confidence: 0.54.

results.idea: IV negative feedback when long-term rising
results.description: If long-term trend rising, adopt mean-revert on short-term: trade_when(greater(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_360, 60), 0), reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30,30)), ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30,30)). SUGGESTION1 combined tenors; complexity kept within operator limits. Confidence: 0.45.

multiply(greater(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,5), ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_30,30)), greater(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, ts_mean(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30,90))) to only trade breakouts with skew confirmation. SUGGESTION1 uses skew and vol. Confidence: 0.50.

results.idea: IV mean divergence across long tenors (720 vs 1080)
results.description: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_720, implied_volatility_mean_1080) to find 1-3 year deviations. SUGGESTION1 applied though userCounts lower for very long tenors. Confidence: 0.38.

Divide(ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_30,30), ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_90,90)) to find names with short-term instability vs medium-term. SUGGESTION1 used stddevs for robustness. Confidence: 0.50.
subtract(implied_volatility_call_60, implied_volatility_mean_60) to capture directional bias in calls. SUGGESTION1 used call and mean. Confidence: 0.52.
subtract(ts_delta(historical_volatility_10, 3), ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_10, 3)) to pick realized-driven moves not priced in. SUGGESTION1 used both realized and implied. Confidence: 0.57.
Use kth_element to backfill if data sparse: kth_element(implied_volatility_mean_30, 5, 1) then zscore. SUGGESTION3 not required by coverage but applied defensively. SUGGESTION2 N/A. Confidence: 0.43.
ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_skew_90, 10) cross-sectional zscore to detect skew breakouts. SUGGESTION1 used skew field. Confidence: 0.46.
divide(implied_volatility_mean_30, ts_mean(implied_volatility_mean_120, 120)) to measure relative expensive cheap. SUGGESTION1 used long-term mean normalization per SUGGESTION4. Confidence: 0.62.
ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_10, 3) zscored cross-sectionally for very short-term trading. SUGGESTION1 used short mean. Confidence: 0.55.
divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30), implied_volatility_mean_30). SUGGESTION1 used to scale skew by level. Confidence: 0.56.
winsorize(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,5), std=4) then zscore to reduce outliers. SUGGESTION1 used winsorize to control tails. Confidence: 0.58.

Only trade when both parkinson_volatility_30 and implied_volatility_mean_30 increase: multiply(greater(ts_delta(parkinson_volatility_30,5),0), greater(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,5),0)). SUGGESTION1 combined signals for confirmation. Confidence: 0.47.
subtract(implied_volatility_mean_10, historical_volatility_360) to detect immediate option mispricing against long-run realized. SUGGESTION1 cross-horizon used. Confidence: 0.45.
divide(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,5), abs(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30) + 1e-6) to penalize extreme skew. SUGGESTION1 combined mean and skew; small epsilon implied. Confidence: 0.48.

results.idea: IV zscore momentum with ts_rank smoothing
results.description: ts_rank(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30, 30), 10) to smooth zscore into rank momentum. SUGGESTION1 used ts_rank for robustness. Confidence: 0.51.
subtract(implied_volatility_call_90, historical_volatility_90). SUGGESTION1 used call and realized at same tenor for direct spread. Confidence: 0.59.
subtract(implied_volatility_mean_30, ts_mean(implied_volatility_mean_30, 10)) to capture short deviation from recent mean. SUGGESTION1 smoothing applied. Confidence: 0.60.
ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, 10) minus ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_skew_360, 60) to isolate accelerated short-term skew moves. SUGGESTION1 used two skew tenors. Confidence: 0.42.
divide(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,3), ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_30,30)) zscored cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 normalization used. Confidence: 0.61.
ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30), 5) to detect accelerating put demand. SUGGESTION1 used put/call delta. Confidence: 0.55.
ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_180, 30) cross-sectional zscore. SUGGESTION1 used 180d mean with strong userCount. Confidence: 0.49.

subtract(ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_30, 20), ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_90, 60)) to find short-term compression vs medium-term. SUGGESTION1 used stddevs for robustness. Confidence: 0.47.
divide(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, historical_volatility_30) to see skew per unit realized vol. SUGGESTION1 used skew and realized. Confidence: 0.44.

results.idea: IV breakout followed by rank fade
results.description: If ts_rank(implied_volatility_mean_10, 10) > 0.9 then fade using reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30,30)). SUGGESTION1 uses short-term rank trigger + medium-term reversion. Confidence: 0.48.
subtract(ts_kurtosis(implied_volatility_mean_360, 180), ts_kurtosis(implied_volatility_mean_30, 30)) to detect regime change in tails. SUGGESTION1 used kurtosis across horizons. Confidence: 0.40.

results.idea: IV momentum scaled by tenor ratio
results.description: divide(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30, 5), subtract(implied_volatility_mean_90, implied_volatility_mean_30)) to focus on moves relative to slope. SUGGESTION1 combined momentum and slope. Confidence: 0.46.
reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_skew_10, 20)) simple skew mean-revert. SUGGESTION1 used skew short tenor. Confidence: 0.49.

results.idea: Implied vol jump detection using ts_arg_max
results.description: if ts_arg_max(implied_volatility_mean_10, 5) == 0 then fade using reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_30, 30)). SUGGESTION1 used arg_max to detect recent maxima. Confidence: 0.47.
Use last_diff_value(implied_volatility_mean_30, 10) to detect recent change points and reverse short-term zscore. SUGGESTION1 applied; operator offers event detection. Confidence: 0.42.

results.idea: Put skew premium vs long-term mean
results.description: subtract(implied_volatility_put_90, ts_mean(implied_volatility_put_90, 180)) to identify sustained put demand. SUGGESTION1 used put mean with decent counts. Confidence: 0.51.
zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_120, implied_volatility_mean_30)) standard cross-sectional slope signal. SUGGESTION1 used robust tenors with good counts. Confidence: 0.58.
